subject: Design
title: DOS: A Command Line for Everyone
description: A short lesson to help you apply DOS: A Command Line for Everyone.

hook.text: In 1981, IBM needed an operating system for its new PC. Microsoft delivered MS-DOS.

buildup.text: DOS showed a blinking cursor and the letter C:\>. That was your entire interface.

discovery.text: You typed commands: DIR to list files, COPY to duplicate them, DEL to erase them forever.

twist.text: Millions of non-technical people had to learn these commands. Most found it terrifying.

climax.text: DOS's hostility to normal users created the demand that made Windows inevitable.

punchline.text: The worst user experience creates the market for the next one.

quiz.question: What command listed files in MS-DOS?
